content.description: Nice warm-up on the far left side of the north face.  Start up the harder-than-it-looks dihedral, hit a small ledge, than cruise up the face.  Would get more stars if it were longer.
content.location: Furthest left route on north face.

content.description: Bouldery crux right off the ground at a small bulge (recommend stick-clipping the first bolt if you can't reach it).  Move up slightly easier ground in a funky groove, head a little left, then launch up the overhanging face on big pockets and rails.  Second crux getting to a jug rail just before the anchors.
content.location: Middle of the north face, just to the right of a 45 degree, 20' tall "wave" of stone.

content.description: Lots of hidden holds on this one. Cool slopers and edges. Crux pretty low, gets easier the higher you go.  A little bit of loose rock in the middle.
content.location: Left of large snag in the middle of the north face.

content.description: Start as per Heart Of Darkness, climbing a technical and crimpy slab.  At the top of the slab, head left up the overhanging headwall.
content.location: Far left side of the north face.

content.description:
Climb the technical slab with the first crux coming low, then finish up an overhang on long reaches between big holds. The second crux comes just before the last bolt pulling past a left-hand scoop to a jug.

The upper part was originally bolted by Zach Miller, and started on gear in a corner that is now heavily vegetated. Apparently he never returned for the redpoint or named it.
content.location: Far left side of the north face.

content.description: Short crux/bulge section offering fun moves sandwiched by mellow slab climbing. Mmmm sandwiches...
content.location:
Starts as for

Law-son

(5.11a) continues around left side of arete climbing into the face on the north side of the cliff.

content.description: Climb widening dihedral to bolted face.  Good climbing, solid rock, steep and juggy.
content.protection: 3 bolts, gear #1 to #4 Camalot.  Lower-off anchors.
content.location: Uphill and left of "No More Bush".

content.description: Thin crux down low, at about the 3rd bolt.  Mid-.10 climbing afterwards.  The original route starts about 10' to the left and apparently involves stemming off a dead tree.  This start is more direct, but a little harder.
content.location: First bolted route on the wall past "Freedom Isn't Free", just right of a large dead tree.

content.description: Start up the dihedral as for "Falcon Roast".  Instead of heading up the bolted arete, move left around the arete.  Cruise up a steep, blocky face with a single bolt, then finish up lower-angle terrain.
content.location: Middle of the north face, look for the Falcon Roast dihedral.

content.description: Follow the line of bolts through crimps and the occasional jug to reach a right leaning feature. Bust a few cruxy moves to gain jugs up and right, and merge into FAF to a new anchor below and left of the FAF anchor. Long draws helpful for managing rope drag. Kind of a pain in the ass to clean while lowering.
content.location: Starts on the far right North Wall, just left of Freedom Aint Free.

content.description: Longer and slightly harder variation to "Smokey The Bear".  Climb the first 5 bolts of Smokey The Bear but continue left up the corner/ramp.  Crux comes passing the 8th bolt on a series of small edges.
content.location: Middle of the north face, just to the right of a 45 degree, 20' tall "wave" of stone.
